name: Playa Azul Golf, Scuba, Spa

reviews.title: Did not Like
reviews.text: After spending 4 days at the JW Marriott in Cancun - no way would I stay at the Playa Azul. When we arrived the Playa Azul, the lobby had no air conditioning, all windows were open and flies everywhere. We booked our stay on line and when we arrived the hotel, they told me that we needed to pay extra for our teens. We entered our room and the musty smell was overwhelming. The beds were hard and damp from the humidity. We then went outside to see the pool - it was filthy. I wouldn't even dip my foot in it. The beach - if you want to call it a beach - was very small. The water area to swim was also very small. It reminded me of a boat slip. No way would I go in the water. We left the hotel and went back to Cancun.

reviews.title: Very quaint
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Playa Azul for 4 days in May 2005. It was very clean. The beds were not as hard as other people have reported. We did have a little trouble controlling the A/C, but it was usually too cold, not too hot. I believe it was because of the humidity--can't do anything about that!! The beach wa small, but never crowded and very clear and pretty. The pool was very clean and nicely kept. They cleaned it everyday. The breakfast buffet was included with our room and was excellent. A lot of variety. All employees very nice and accomodating. They supply you with plenty of bottled water, so no worries there. Overall, we had a very nice stay.
Just returned from Cozumel after a week stay beginning on March 4th. Had a fantastic time. My wife and I (28 and 30) would return in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Week in Recap - Young couple
Playa Azul is Great!
reviews.text: We stayed at the Playa-Azul the week of Jan 14 through 21, 2006. We had a wonderful time, despite the ongoing reconstruction due to the hurricane, and the fact that the weather wasn't totally cooperative.

reviews.title: Great Place!
reviews.text: This is a mavelous, small hotel, with a friendly staff and great service. It's clean, quiet, and spacious, with its own nice beachfront and pool.

reviews.title: Playa Azul, a great place to stay
reviews.text: There IS hurricane damage, to be sure, but the hotel is functioning quite well. The most noticeable signs of the damage are the lack of dining space (all meals are served on the outdoor, covered veranda right now), and the painters and other contractors who are working around the place during the day. But the work is quite unobtrusive and non-invasive.
I loved the beach chairs, each pair with its own palapa and table, and the rebuilt sandy beach. The beachfront that goes down to the water is still rocky, though, so snorkel shoes are recommended!
reviews.title: First Beach Vacation
Relaxing with great service...
reviews.text: We thought the staff were great! Hernan at the front desk helped me place phone calls to my bank and to order pizza, he also helped us rent a car (and made sure we got a 2005 one!). The wait staff in the restaurant were friendly, too, and always willing to make a special order if needed.

reviews.title: Great for golf
reviews.text: We just returned from 8 days at Playa Azul. The beach is beautiful, the restaurant was great and the golf was as advertised. We payed $50 for 2 people for cart fees each time we golfed.
